explanation: The code appended each input as a string (using str(input())), so c.sort() performed lexicographic sorting rather than numeric sorting â€” e.g. '10' would come before '2'. I changed the single incorrect line to convert inputs to integers (int(input())) so the list is sorted numerically.
fixed_code:
a,b=map(int,input().split())
c=[]
for i in range(a):
    c.append(int(input()))
c.sort()
c=c[0:b]
for i in c:
  print(i)
